required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation in Older Women With Gonarthrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation About Functional Performance, Pain and Quality of Life in Older Women With Gonarthrosis: Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effectiveness of the method Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation (PNF) as physical therapy approach to the reduction of pain and improvement in functional performance and quality of life in women with knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be divided into two groups: group perform proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation and other group submit performing resistance exercises.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in quality of life 6th-12th week
primary_outcome.description: (Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Questionaire - WOMAC"

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change based on functional performance 6th - 12th week
Change based on functional performance 6th - 12th week
primary_outcome.description: Medical Outcomes Study 36 - Item Short - Form Health Survey SF-36)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change based on functional performance 6th - 12th week
primary_outcome.description: "Walk Test of 40 meters at a rapid pace

primary_outcome.time_frame: "Walk Test of 40 meters at a rapid pace

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in pain threshold 6th-12th week pressure
"change from baseline in the range of knee flexion 6th-12th week"

arm_group.description: Proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation, using the technique of rhythmic initiation and Combination of Isotonic on lower members
Resistance exercise to strengthen lower limbs

intervention.description: Proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation, using the technique of rhythmic initiation and Combination of Isotonic on lower members
resistance exercise to strengthen lower limbs
